description:
Laughs and shenanigans are on the horizon in this crossover! Fan-favorite characters from Kanon, Air, Clannad, Little Busters!, Rewrite, and more start the school year together in a new world where anything is possible. With so much personality in one anime universe, every day feels like a new kind of dream.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: ไขกุญแจข้ามโลก

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

title.native: ＣＬＡＮＮＡＤ ~After Story~ クラナド アフターストーリー
かぎなど シーズン２

node.description:
Key is a Japanese visual novel studio. It is known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. Some of their most famous works include CLANNAD, planetarian, and Little Busters!, among others. Several of their visual novels have received anime adaptations, making them quite well-known even outside of the visual novel community.

They've also formed Key Sounds Label for their music tracks, and they produced an Internet radio show called Key Net Radio which is now defunct as of 2010. Key works under the publishing company Visual Arts, where it originally sprung out of.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iktd13_)

Na-Ga is a male Japanese artist who is employed as a graphic designer and illustrator for the company Key known for such famous visual novels as Kanon, Air, and Clannad among others. Prior to working for Key, he was employed by the visual novel company Pearl Soft. Na-Ga has been working for Key since the production of Air as one of the computer graphic artists, but was able to majorly contribute to character design in Key's sixth visual novel Little Busters! with Itaru Hinoue, along with the later released Little Busters! Ecstasy and Kud Wafter. For Key's ninth title Rewrite, Na-Ga contributed to the game's computer graphics.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hinoueitaru) | [Website](https://hinoueitaru.com/)
Artist for various bishoujo games, mainly Key.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/okano_tohya)

Touya Okano is a Japanese scenario writer and producer, affiliated with [Visual Arts](https://anilist.co/studio/203/Visual-Arts). On 27th July 2023 he was announced to be the new director of Visual Arts, and transferred his share to Tencent, making Visual Arts a child company of Tencent

[Official Website](https://lia-music.jp/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Liabobo3) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lia_vocalist/?hl=en)

She is affiliated with the group, Veil.  Sampling voice for Vocaloid, [IA](https://anilist.co/staff/124349/IA)

__Kazuya Takase__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and founder of the sound unit I've Sound, which features the so-called "Love Planet Five", which is composed of 5 prolific singers in the Trance/J-pop industry (KOTOKO, Kaori Utatsuki, Eiko Shimamiya, MELL, and Mami Kawada).  Takase acts as a composer and arranger for the themes and OSTs of various anime and eroge games.
Musical composer, widely known for his work in Air TV, Kanon, Clannad, Little Busters, and other Key pieces.

__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/punipoyo)

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.  

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://www2.odn.ne.jp/~cai16580/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mikeou_) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=551282)

She is a freelance Japanese mangaka, illustrator, and game artist.
